message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This research paper utilizes data from the World Values Survey and the Global Religious Futures Project to explore the relationship between religiosity and economic development across countries.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Global Religious Futures Project"], "topic": ["Socio-economic Development"]}, {"sentence": "We employed a dataset from the LSMS-ISA surveys conducted in Ethiopia and Nigeria, supplemented with primary data collection on household assets to investigate the relationship between household wealth and education outcomes.", "dataset": ["LSMS-ISA surveys", "primary data collection on household assets"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Inequality Database on top income shares and national accounts, we examined the drivers of recent trends in income inequality in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Inequality Database", "national accounts"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Our study utilized micro-data from the International Crime Victims Surveys, which included information on both crime incidence and subjective perceptions of safety to explore the determinants of public perception of safety.", "dataset": ["International Crime Victims Surveys"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To assess health impact, we utilized data from the WHO Study on global AGEing and adult health (SAGE) survey, which gathered longitudinal data on chronic disease prevalence.", "dataset": ["WHO Study on global AGEing and adult health (SAGE) survey"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data analysis on a variety of sources including the Doing Business report and World Bank Enterprise Surveys for the period 2005-2017, we explored factors that drive firm productivity, access to finance, and innovation in emerging markets.", "dataset": ["Doing Business report", "World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We utilized data from the United Nations Comtrade database and corroborated it with information on enforced laws specific to wildlife and forestry trade obtained from the World Bank Group's Environmental, Social and Governance dataset to identify patterns and drivers of illegal wildlife and forestry trade.", "dataset": ["United Nations Comtrade database", "World Bank Group's Environmental, Social and Governance dataset"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Our research utilized household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS) and the Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (ISA), together with weather station data from the National Meteorological Agency, to study whether rainfall shocks impact food security in Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS)", "Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (ISA)", "National Meteorological Agency"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Disaster Risk Management"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the OECD PISA surveys and national ministries of education for several countries, we examined the effectiveness of education policies on learning outcomes, particularly in the context of digital learning technologies.", "dataset": ["OECD PISA surveys", "national ministries of education"], "topic": ["Education", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed data from multiple sources including the Global Findex Database and a customer survey conducted by a major bank in Argentina to explore factors that affect households' decision to choose formal versus informal credit markets in the Latin American region.", "dataset": ["Global Findex Database", "customer survey conducted by a major bank in Argentina"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Latin America"]} ]

content: [{"sentence": "This research paper utilizes data from the World Values Survey and the Global Religious Futures Project to explore the relationship between religiosity and economic development across countries.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Global Religious Futures Project"], "topic": ["Socio-economic Development"]}, {"sentence": "We employed a dataset from the LSMS-ISA surveys drive firm productivity, access to finance, and innovation in emerging markets.", "dataset": ["Doing Business report", "World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We markets in the Latin American region.", "dataset": ["Global Findex Database", "customer survey conducted by a major bank in Argentina"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Latin America"]} ]
